text:
:man-facepalming: Yes it does. Largely. Thanks. Not sure how I missed that. That covers 99% of our use cases. Thank you.

The only thing I’d like to add is maybe a modifier logic, but I imagine we’re the only ones.
In the system we built that we’re replacing and building into HubSpot now, you could hold down Shift to essentially change the step size from e.g. from 1 to 10 or from 1000 to 10000.
If we could have an “alternativeStep” property or something along those lines that is accessed by holding down shift while pressing up or down, I’d be a very happy man. Again.. we’re probably one of the only ones.

Hello. everyone.
I have a question. could you help me, please?

Why this error occur?
I use hs project upload.
However, even though I installed <@UDA553DRD>/cli@latest, this error continues to occur.

I think I built correctly.
I just hs project create and hs project upload .

<@U03FJQPSC0Y> <@U05KNCMAE7N> Hey guys are there any plans on adding additional user properties in the context object? Recently there was an update that allows us to create user properties, and I feel that if we could retrieve those properties via context it could be helpful for things like setting more granular user permissions. I know that these can likely be fetched using the Users API endpoint but it would certainly be nice if we didn't have to make an api call to access these properties.

Amazing! That is great to hear.

> I imagine we’re the only ones.
You'd be surprised at how many of these are applicable to others too, so its very helpful to hear :slightly_smiling_face: Making sure I'm understanding correctly: you'd like for a number input such that the customer could change the input via the keyboard for easier and quicker input change. Is that correct?
Have you opted into the beta? Under product updates: React CRM Cards

:mega::sprocket-dance:Hello developers! Tagging along some more *UI Component updates:*

• NEW *<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/loadingbutton|LoadingButton>:* to give immediate feedback so that users are informed of the progress of their actions. 
• Just added *5 new <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/icon|Icon> names* (`bulb`, `home`, `copy`, `question` , `settings` ). Screenshot below. _Pro tip: the_ `copy` _icon pairs well with the new *<https://HubSpot-connect.slack.com/archives/C06NNQN8611/p1722541511467709|copy to clipboard action>*!_
Hi <@U02F2QPB4P8> - exciting news: we just added 5 new <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/icon|Icon names>. Thanks for your feedback!

Can you use LoadingButtons with the Button row component?

It's a little interesting why this is a completely new component instead of just adding those props to the current button component.

> Can you use LoadingButtons with the Button row component?
Yes that should be possible.

> It's a little interesting why this is a completely new component instead of just adding those props to the current button component.
It's a good point and we discussed this too. One of the reasons was that it doesn't make sense to have a LoadingButton for all the variants (for eg: `transparent`). Separating these two would make it simpler
ah got it, yeah I haven't really seen any transparent buttons recently so honestly just forgot about them. Appreciate the reply
